message: Hello Bob, thank you for considering my product. I'm excited to offer it to you at a price of $11,500. I believe it's a great value for the quality and features it offers, and I'm confident you'll be happy with your purchase.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. While I appreciate the quality of the product, $11,500 is a bit more than I'm comfortable paying right now.  I'm willing to offer $10,500.  Let me know what you think.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand that $11,500 is a bit steep, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $11,000. I think this is a fair price considering the value it brings to your business.
Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price, but $11,000 is still a bit high for my budget. I'm willing to go up to $10,750.  Let's see if we can find a middle ground.

I understand that $10,750 is still a bit above your target, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession. I'll sell the product to you for $10,900. This is the lowest price I'm willing to accept, considering the value it brings to your business.
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  Let's meet in the middle at $10,825. I'm confident this price reflects the value of the product and allows for a mutually beneficial agreement.

I'm getting close to accepting your offer, Bob, but I still need to make a bit more profit. I'm willing to meet you at $10,800. This is the best I can do, considering the value of the product and the time I've invested in it.
